title: Problem 2162_D
statement: This is an interactive problem.There is a permutation^{\text{∗}} p of length n.Someone secretly chose two integers l, r (1 ≤ l ≤ r ≤ n) and modified the permutation in the following way: For every index i such that l ≤ i ≤ r, set p_i := p_i + 1. Let a denote the resulting array obtained by modifying the permutation.You are given an integer n denoting the length of the permutation p.In one query, you are allowed to choose two integers l, r (1 ≤ l ≤ r ≤ n) and ask for the sum of the subarray eithe
